sentence.idiomatic: This complex is really quiet, and the green space is quite nice.
I've heard that the government has decided to add greenery to that district.
I haven't been here for a few years. They've really added to the greenbelt.
These past few rainy days it's been terribly cold.
Our family's baby is beyond cute.
His Chinese is amazingly good.
There are the most public security problems at the end of the year.
The public security in Shanghai is not bad, right?
The public security in that city isn't great--you need to be careful.
I would guess that he has studied Chinese for at least half a year.
I'm not able to estimate how many people will come to tomorrow's gathering.
I'd estimate that that piece of clothing costs more than 1,000 RMB, doesn't it?
Shanghai has always been a very vibrant city.
He looks very healthy and full of vigor.
You don't have any energy--what's with you today?
Sitting in the office working for long periods of time is not good for your health.
It's so comfortable here. Do you want to keep living here for a long period of time?
I've been away from home for a long time. I spend less and less time with my parents.
Your spoken Chinese is quite local sounding.
I always speak Chinese, so I speak my native dialect quite poorly now.
If you look at his appearance and disposition, he's definitely a northern guy.
I only have 100 RMB at the moment.
Only if she goes with me will I go.
Only if everyone works hard together will we be able to finish the work.
What do you think, is Singapore fun?
It's pretty good. The greenery is really amazing, and it's incredibly clean. It really is the 'garden country.'
I've heard that personal security is also especially good.
Uh-huh, I would say it's the safest country in the world. You can walk around on the streets in the middle of the night and don't feel afraid at all.
The only thing is that it's too small. Do you think living there is boring?

Although it's small, there are a lot of ethnic groups; there are Chinese people, Malaysians, Indians. Plus, there are people from all over the world there for work or tourism, so Singapore is really vibrant.
But if you live there for a long time, it could get a little boring. Oh yeah, a lot of people say that the food there is really unique.
Yes, there is so much to choose from. Plus, the best food is from the small shops on the side of the road. They are cheap and good.
It also must be really authentic. Did you eat Hainan Chicken Rice?
Of course! It's really delicious. I also ate Black Pepper Crab. You can only get that flavor in Singapore.
Hey, where did you go for fun?
We went to all the famous sites. I'll show you the pictures.
Sure.
